title: Largest Number At Least Twice of Others
content:
You are given an integer array nums where the largest integer is unique.

Determine whether the largest element in the array is at least twice as much as every other number in the array. If it is, return the index of the largest element, or return -1 otherwise.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [3,6,1,0]
Output: 1
Explanation: 6 is the largest integer.
For every other number in the array x, 6 is at least twice as big as x.
The index of value 6 is 1, so we return 1.

Example 2:

Input: nums = [1,2,3,4]
Output: -1
Explanation: 4 is less than twice the value of 3, so we return -1.

 

Constraints:

  • 2 <= nums.length <= 50
  • 0 <= nums[i] <= 100
  • The largest element in nums is unique.

discussion_posts.content: We can do this in one pass with `O(1)` space...\n\nThink about what we need to keep track of. Really we only need to know the largest and second largest numbers. Then we can multiply the second largest by two and see if that is less than or equal to the largest. If it is, return the position of the largest, if it is not, return -1;

discussion_posts.content: I think it\'s a good task, and I even liked it. The task itself is not a problem. The problem is that the task is a step or two easier than the usual easy-class tasks.\n\nI think Leetcode really needs such tasks, so as not to discourage complete beginners, making them cry over perverted trees or dynamic programming.
